about: This is a project from Bogazici University, TABILAB group. Together with the repository service, the purpose of the project is to provide an open research framework and also present some of the work in an interactive way in this website.

home.header: Collection of TABILAB NLP tool demos
home.content: TABILAB (Text and Bioinformatics Labaratory) is a research group at Bogazici University, focusing on Bioinformatics and Natural Language Processing. This website serves some of the tools implemented by the lab members as interactive demos.

addTool.description: Please explain the tool in detail
addTool.usageInformation: How to use this tool, what are inputs and outputs
addTool.citing: Please Write the citation if there is
addTool.funding: you can write the fundign of the tool
addTool.gitAddress: Also you should enter the git address which is used by proxy to save the input/output specifications of the given program.
addTool.enum: Finally, you also specify a 'unique' name for the program and a human readable name
addTool.name: Corpus Name
addTool.version: please explain the version of tool
addTool.update_time: please write last update date of tool
addTool.languages: Select the language(s) that resource supports
addTool.bibtex: If there is a paper, specify the paper information about the tool in BibTeX Citation
addTool.links: You can add related links here.
addTool.endpoint: You must give a endpoint of API
addTool.inout: You must specify input and outputs

mparser.content:
Write each sentence in a newline. End-of-sentence markers should be seperated from the previous token with white spaces. 

Example:
 "Şekerleri yedim ."
"Eve gittim ."
mparser.description: Morphological Analysis is the process of finding the correct morphemes of a word.

sentiment.description: Sentiment analysis is the task to determine the polarity of a given query. In this demo, binary sentiment analysis is running.

dparser.description: Dependency parsing is the process of finding the right dependencies in a sentence(s).

ner.description: Named Entity Recognition (NER) is the task of finding entities of words/clauses in a given text.

mwe.description:
Multiword Expression Identification is the task of finding multiword expressions in a given text. 
For example for the Turkish sentence "Hafta sonları, huzur evlerini ziyaret etmeye çalışırım" has three different MWEs, namely "hafta sonu", "huzur evi", and "ziyaret etmek"

mparser1_info.paper_name: Morphological Parser, Morphological Disambiguator and Web Corpus
mparser1_info.paper_authors: Haşim Sak, Tunga Güngör, Murat Saraçlar

sentiment1_info.paper_name: Generating Word and Document Embeddings for Sentiment Analysis
sentiment1_info.paper_authors: Cem Rıfkı Aydın, Tunga Güngör, Ali Erkan

ner1_info.paper_name: Improving Named Entity Recognition by Jointly Learning to Disambiguate Morphological Tags
ner1_info.paper_authors: Onur Güngör, Suzan Üsküdarlı, Tunga Güngör

dparser1_info.paper_name: A Hybrid Approach to Dependency Parsing: Combining Rules and Morphology with Deep Learning
dparser1_info.paper_authors: Şaziye Betül Özateş, Arzucan Özgür, Tunga Güngör, Balkız Öztürk

mwe1_info.paper_name: Deep-BGT at PARSEME Shared Task 2018: Bidirectional LSTM-CRF Model for Verbal Multiword Expression Identification
mwe1_info.paper_authors: Gözde Berk, Berna Erden, Tunga Güngör
